newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Pacific BBA buys out Malaysian partner.
newsitem.headline: Pacific BBA buys out Malaysian partner.

text.p: Diversified manufacturing group Pacific BBA Ltd said on Friday it had bought out its minority partner in its Malaysian automotive business, PBR Automotive (Malaysia).
A Pacific BBA spokesman said the stake was bought from the former Malaysian government investment body Hicom Holdings Bhd for an undisclosed sum.
The size of the stake was also not disclosed.
Pacific BBA said it would look for another local joint venture partner over the next two years as it was required to do so under laws governing foreign investments.
The Malaysian company supplies brake and clutch components to car-maker Proton and the regional replacement market and had annual sales of about A$25 million, a company official said.

"This investment is consistent with our strategy to expand our automotive activities in the ASEAN region. We are fast localising the manufacturing of components rather than importing them, thereby eliminating exchange rate risks," Pacific BBA Managing Director Barry Jackson said in a statement.
